subject: Re: [junit] NoSuchMethodError: java.lang.String.isEmpty()

Sorry for the noise - I see this was reported and fixed in 4.9b3, which
works fine with Java 1.5.

Thanks!
Michael

On 14/07/11 21:17, mdotrogers wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> I'm using JUnit 4.9b2 for a cross-platform project that needs to run on OS X 10.4, where the highest available version of Java is 1.5. When running JUnit tests with ant's junit task, I get the following error when a test fails:
> 
> [junit] Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: java.lang.String.isEmpty()Z
> 
> String.isEmpty() was added in Java 1.6, so I guess I need to find an older version of JUnit that doesn't call that method. Can anyone tell me the newest version of JUnit that's compatible with Java 1.5?
> 
> Thanks,
> Michael
>
